name: Lighthouz AI
headline: AI procurement specialists for manufacturers
description:
Lighthouz AI is building AI procurement specialists for manufacturers. 

500k procurement professionals spend 90% of their day emailing suppliers and entering data on spreadsheets and outdated ERP. 

Lighthouz's AI procurement specialists disrupts this entire profession. It 15x'es the productivity of procurement teams. It automates all manual procurement tasks including data verification and entry on ERP. Our AI agents will replace 500k jobs in the next 10 years. 

Our team has 20+ years of combined AI experience: 
- Srijan has been a GaTech CS professor, research scientist @ Google, postdoc @ Stanford AI lab, PhD @ UMD, BTech @ IIT. He has built AI  systems now in production at Meta, Home Depot, etc. He has written 60+ papers that are cited 6000+ times. 
- Sonali was a lead AI engineer at Progressive insurance, American Family insurance, Halliburton, did her MS at University of Washington, and undergrad at IIT.
tags: industry:saas; industry:workflow-automation; industry:supply-chain; industry:ai; industry:ai-assistant; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Srijan Kumar, CEO & Co-founder
founders.description:
I'm an award-winning AI professor-turned-entrepreneur. Over the last 14 years, my AI systems have been used at Meta, Wikipedia, The Home Depot, and Flipkart. I have been a Georgia Tech professor and worked at Google, Stanford, CMU, and UMD, and IIT. I pioneered dynamic graph neural nets. I have written 60+ AI publications w 6000+ citations. Awards won: NSF CAREER, Forbes 30u30, Kavli Fellow.

Now I'm building AI agents that can autonomously do procurement, powered by dynamic knowledge graphs.

founders.name: Sonali Pattnaik, CTO & Co-founder
founders.description:
Sonali is the CTO and Co-founder of Lighthouz.

Previously, she has led AI teams at enterprises such as Progressive, American Family, and Halliburton, where she spearheaded innovative AI solutions. With experience in building and deploying AI technologies, she holds multiple US patents and papers. Working across multiple industries, Sonali has gained expertise in tackling business problems from inception to full implementation using AI solutions.

With Pam, you move at the speed of thought
Intelligent Data Entry on ERP
Extracts data from quotes, invoices, order acknowledgements, & emails
Enters data on your ERP system including SAP, Netsuite, and others
PO Creation, Done Intelligently
Automatically compare quotes and create POs with no manual work
No more copy-pasting data (again) to create POs
Real-time Invoice Auditing, Intelligently
Identify errors in invoices by finding discrepancies with POs
Intelligent invoice auditing ensures you are not overpaying
Save hours of work in manually matching invoices for correctness
Supplier Communication with Intelligence
Autonomously communicate with suppliers
Understands supplier requests and updates to respond accordingly
You get alerted when Pam needs your attention

generated_description:
**Lighthouz AI: Revolutionizing Procurement Through Automation**

Lighthouz AI is an exciting startup on a mission to transform the procurement landscape for manufacturers. Launched in 2023 as part of Y Combinator's Batch S24 and located in San Francisco, the company aims to leverage artificial intelligence to vastly improve productivity among procurement professionals—specifically the 500,000 workers who currently spend up to 90% of their time bogged down with tedious tasks like emailing suppliers and data entry in outdated ERP systems.

The brainchild behind this innovation, Dr. Srijan Kumar, has a resume that speaks volumes: former research scientist at Google, professor at Georgia Tech, and experience building AI systems for major companies like Meta and Home Depot. Alongside him is Sonali Pattnaik, a former lead AI engineer with a proven track record of saving millions at various firms. Together, they bring over 20 years of combined expertise to the table.

What’s their secret sauce? **Enter Pam**, the AI procurement assistant, designed to automate manual procurement tasks—effectively set to increase team productivity by a staggering 15 times. Pam takes over the heavy lifting: it handles data verification, invoice auditing, purchase order (PO) creation, and even supplier communications. By automating up to 80% of these tasks, Lighthouz AI not only saves countless hours but also mitigates the risk of human error, such as overbilling.

But the impact goes beyond just efficiency. Lighthouz AI’s technology is poised to disrupt the procurement profession as we know it, projecting a significant transformation in the workforce over the next decade. With automation taking root, the reality is that many procurement jobs may see monumental shifts—500,000 roles potentially replaced. 

Their service is tagged as ‘SaaS’, ‘workflow-automation’, and ‘ai’, among others, signaling a blend of modern technology and operational efficiency. With a compact but skilled team of just three employees, including Dr. Kumar and Sonali Pattnaik, Lighthouz AI's focus remains clear: to reinvent procurement workflows and deliver tangible results for manufacturers.

So, if you’re looking to future-proof your procurement processes, Lighthouz AI and its intelligent assistant Pam might just be your go-to. They are not just selling software; they’re reshaping the future of work, one automated task at a time.

You can learn more about their groundbreaking work on their website: [Lighthouz.ai](https://lighthouz.ai/).
